thread.title: Man City legend Shaun Goater appointed new boss of non-league minnows Ilkeston Town
thread.title_full: Man City legend Shaun Goater appointed new boss of non-league minnows Ilkeston Town

author: gsweet
title: Man City legend Shaun Goater appointed new boss of non-league minnows Ilkeston Town
text:
Comments SHAUN GOATER is Ilkeston Town’s new manager. 
The former Manchester City star – known as ‘The Goat’– has been asked to arrest a poor run of results in the Northern Premier League. Getty Images 3 Shaun Goater behind the mike at Manchester City 
Ilkeston are second to bottom in the table and are relying on the much-travelled former Bermuda international, who has come out of retirement to help them out, to make a much-needed difference. 
Keep up to date with ALL the Premier League gossip and transfers on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary 
Ilkeston have a number of Bermuda players in their squad and this has influenced Goater’s decision to join them. 
A club statement read: “Shaun is excited about the difficult challenge over the next 10 weeks or so, stating he is a great believer in helping young talent to develop. Feed the goat and he will soar! Manchester City legend Shaun Goater will be the new Ilkeston Town manager @nonleagueshow @NonLeaguePaper 
— Sam Elliott (@SamElliott_NLP) February 17, 2017 
“He is confident he can step in and help the Robins youngsters get a little more organised and push on… Related Stories SHINDIG Florentin Pogba shows off his custom shinpads with brother Paul's face... but he's still wearing a Juventus shirt Ars out? Under-fire Arsene Wenger finally admits he could leave Arsenal THIS season as he faces decision over future GENT OUT OF SHAPE Pochettino watches stuttering Spurs slump to another loss and moans: We’re in a bad way 'Too noisy, too funny and too relaxed' Jose Mourinho blasts his stars for lack of professionalism in build-up to St Etienne win I'M IN THE MONEY Former Arsenal and Real Madrid star Lassana Diarra is heading to the Chinese Super League IMPS IN A HUDL High-tech Lincoln City warn Burnley they've figured out how to pull off FA Cup shock 
“Like he says its a tough ask to get to safety, but there are still a lot of points still to play for and games against teams around the bottom of the NPL Premier division. 
“He has watched Ilkeston’s progress over the last few seasons; in fact he was at Curzon Ashton as a guest of the club in the play-off final two seasons ago. His interest has been drawn now that we have several Bermudian players at the club. News Group Newspapers Ltd Goater at his rampaging best with Manchester City PA:Press Association 3 ‘The Goat’ in action for Southend, where he hit 11 goals in 33 games 
“What Shaun he wants now is to get into football management, being a student of the game he loves nothing more than dropping in to watch the top coaches in action. 
“He see’s Ilkeston as an opportunity to experiment with his experience and new ideas. He is looking forward to getting really involved in football as a manager. Manchester City women sign big name USA star Carli Lloyd 
"He has had his ups and downs in the game and is eager to share his knowledge with the Ilkeston youngsters." 
Goater is best known for his spell at Manchetser City, where he fired 103 goals in 212 appearaces between 1998-2003.
